title.narrative: Republic of Congo Support to Basic Education Project

description.narrative: The revised project development objective is to improve efficiency, quality and equity in the provision of basic education in theterritory of the Recipient with a view to achieving universal quality primary education by 2015.

condition.narrative: 1st FMR be provided to IDA no later than 45 days after 1st calendar quarter (CQ) after effective date and period of 1stexpenditurethrough end of first CQ. FMR to IDA no later thn 45 days after CQ
Appropriate contract concluded between Recipient and Service Provider (SP) terms/conditions approved by IDA
Except as IDA shall otherwise agreed, procurement required and financed out of proceeds from Grant shall be governed by provisionsof Schedule 3, as said provisions may be elab in procurement plan
For all expenditures (from Grant Account on basis of SOE), Recipient shall enable IDA representative to examine such records
For all expenditures (with respect to withdrawals from Grant acct on basis of SOEs), Recipient shall retain at least 2 years afterIDA has rec'd audit for semester, all records evidencing expenditures
Project counterpart funding
Recipient provide to IDA, satisfactory substance and form to IDA, FMR showing sources/uses of project funds cumulatively and forperiod of report explaining variances btw plan/actual
Recipient estab/maintain FM system (incl. records and accts) and prepare financial statements in accord. with IDA acceptedstandards, that reflect its operations, rscs, expendit related to Project
Recipient shall afford IDA opportunity to exchange views on plan mentioned in 3.04a
Recipient shall carry out Project in accordance with Implem Program in Schedule 4
Recipient shall ensure that SP has qualifications and experience that shall be at all times satisfactory to IDA
Recipient shall furnish to IDA no later than 4 months after end of each semester (or as IDA specifies) 1) certified financialstatements for semester (or period determined by IDA) as so audited
Recipient shall furnish to IDA no later than 4 months after end of semester (or period determined by IDA) an opinion on statementsmentioned in 4.01b(ii) and report of audit
Recipient shall furnish to IDA other info concerning records, accts, financial statements and audit and concerning auditors, asIDAshall from time to time reasonably request
Recipient shall have records. accts, financial statements (para a of section 4) audited (standards acceptable to IDA andindependent auditor acceptable to IDA)
Recipient shall prepare on basis of IDA guidelines, no later than 6 months after closing date (or agreed on date with IDA) a planfor future operation of Project
Recipient shall provide to IDA a FMR, in form and substance acceptable to IDA, which sets forth procurement status as at end ofperiod of report above
Recipient shall provide to IDA, satisfactory in form and substance to IDA, FMR describing physical progress in project implement,cumulatively and for report period and explains variats. btw plan/actu
Recipient shall take all measures required on its part to enable SP to implement contract referred to in 3.02 with due diligenceand in accordance with PIM
Recipient shall update procurement plan (following IDA guidelines) and furnish such update to IDA no later than 12 months afterdate of preceeding procurement plan for IDA approval
Will carry out project in conformity with appropriate practices and will provide resources required for Project

title.narrative: A sectoral strategy for EFA-FTI approved
Number of additional qualified primary teachers resulting from project interventions.

comment.narrative: The baseline and results presented in this ISR refer only to the period after restructuring (May 2012 onwards), and according tothe revise results framework in the restructuring paper.

title.narrative: The first round of standardized tests is carried out at the end of school year 2010/2011 and continues in following years
Regularity of annual statistics production with key sector indicators

comment.narrative: this is a new indicator being introduced
Annual statistics have been produced but often delayed in terms of their production and publication
Civil works are still on-going and the indicator should approach the target by June 30.

title.narrative: Indigenous children having received pedagogical materials and uniforms
Primary teachers having received in-service training
Number of additional classrooms built or rehabilitated at the primary level resulting from project interventions.
Textbooks in Math and Civic Education at primary level bought and distributed
Lower secondary teachers having received in-service training
Inspectors and pedagogical advisors for primary having received training

comment.narrative: This indicator will not be met.Preliminary data from school year 2011/12.

title.narrative: Strategy for social inclusion and schooling for the indigenous children implemented

comment.narrative: The strategy is already under implementation and a study on its impact is under way.

title.narrative: Implementation of the new curricula strategy has started by the end of the project

comment.narrative: The strategy is already under implementation.

title.narrative: Suitable system for follow up trained out of school youth is operational and producing timely information
Girl Boy Ratio of Primary School Enrollment (Equity)

comment.narrative: Target has already been exceeded.Preliminary data from school year 2011/12.
Target has been exceeded.Preliminary data from school year 2011/12.

title.narrative: The share of education expenditures as total government expenditures increases from 13% in 2008 to 16% in 2011

comment.narrative: The previous value was wrongly calculated.

title.narrative: The share of education budget allocated to primary level increases from 19% in 2008 to 25% in 2011
The number of out-of-school youth aged 14-19 who completed vocational training is 1,600 by end of project

comment.narrative: At present 1,423 youth have started their one-year training program after contracts have been signed with the enterprises
The target has been almost fully met.

title.narrative: CGDCs having a school development plan
The percentage of out of school youth who are working in a new activity 6 months after finishing the programs is at least 50%

comment.narrative: This is the result of the program undertaken under the original project. 318 youth out of 512 are being employed by theenterprisesthat have trained them.

title.narrative: The number of autochtone children enrolled in the formal education increases from 2,100 in 2009 to 4,000 at end of project

comment.narrative: Although progress has been made through procurement of software and training of staff, education statistics are produced with ayear of delay and there are still issues with their quality.

title.narrative: Textbooks in French and Mathematics at junior secondary level, bought and distributed
